intro: Cassebeera petiolata, commonly known as the white-flowered cassava, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid climate to flourish.
